intro: Syncalathium sukaczevii var. pilosum, commonly known as the hairy syncalathium, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plant is native to specific regions in Central Asia, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its morphological features, such as the dense pubescence on its foliage, are adaptations to its harsh native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
